articles.name: Does changing my profile name in support updates my name in Zendesk QA?
articles.title: Does changing my profile name in support updates my name in Zendesk QA?
articles.body:
Question

If I want to change my profile name in Support, will it also update my name in Zendesk QA? 

Answer

Zendesk Support doesn't synchronize updates to Zendesk QA when it comes to updating profile details. However, users can manually change their name in Zendesk QA depending on granted permission.

For more information, see this article: Managing users and workspaces.

articles.name: Announcing an additional condition for deletion schedules
articles.title: Announcing an additional condition for deletion schedules
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout on
August 22, 2024 August 22, 2024

Zendesk has made it easier for customers without the Advanced Data Protection & Privacy add-on to delete tickets. When creating deletion schedules, you can now delete tickets based on a specific condition. For example, you can delete tickets that include or exclude a certain brand, group, or ticket tag.

For more information, see Creating deletion schedules for data retention policies.

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

Admins and agents in custom roles with permissions can now add one additional condition to the ticket deletion schedule workflow to segment their tickets. After specifying the Last updated criteria for deleting tickets, agents can click Add condition to add another condition.

Agents can choose one additional condition from the dropdown list: custom fields, brand, form, group, organization, requester, tags or type. They can then choose any of the given operators to include or exclude tickets with the criteria from being deleted with a deletion schedule.

In the example above, the deletion schedule will delete all tickets that have been closed and not updated for three years and do not contain the tags “retention” and “do-not-delete.”

The Advanced Data Privacy and Protection (ADPP) add-on is recommended when creating advanced data retention policies because it allows you to activate multiple deletion schedules. The add-on also lets you build multiple custom conditions for deleting tickets. See Creating multiple ticket deletion schedules for advanced data retention policies.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

Zendesk understands there are tickets you might need to keep from being deleted and this gives you flexibility to exclude certain tickets from deletion.

What do I need to do?

This feature is available in your account now; no action is required. You can go to Admin Center > Account > Security > Deletion schedules to create a ticket deletion schedule and add an additional condition.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Can I change an assignment in Zendesk QA without resetting the cycle?
articles.title: Can I change an assignment in Zendesk QA without resetting the cycle?
articles.body:
Question

I need to update an assignment but I don't want to lose the cycle's progress. Can I change the assignment without resetting the goal?

Answer

When publishing changes to an assignment mid-cycle, your progress won't be reset. All given reviews will count towards the goal of the assignment.

For more information, see this article: Setting up assignments.

articles.name: Emergency Maintenance - August 24, 2024 | Pods 13, 20, 23, 25, 26, 27, 29 | Support (Agent Workspace Messaging) - Database Maintenance
articles.title: Emergency Maintenance - August 24, 2024 | Pods 13, 20, 23, 25, 26, 27, 29 | Support (Agent Workspace Messaging) - Database Maintenance
articles.body:
Zendesk will perform critical maintenance on August 24, 2024 which will impact performance for Agent Workspace Messaging customers on Pods 13, 20, 23, 25, 26, 27 and 29, during the times listed below.

Affected products: Support (Agent Workspace - Messaging)

Important: Agent Workspace improved messaging backend customers will be impacted, based on the Pod maintenance dates and timings below.
Customers Affected: Zendesk customers on the Agent Workspace improved messaging backend will experience a brief service disruption of up to 20 minutes at some time within the  maintenance window.

Date

POD

Start Time

End Time

Sat - Aug 24, 2024

26

02:00 UTC /
19:00 PDT (Aug 23)

04:00 UTC /
21:00 PDT (Aug 23)

Sat - Aug 24, 2024

13, 20, 23, 25, 27, 29

17:00 UTC /
10:00 PDT

21:00 UTC /
14:00 PDT

Expected behavior:

During the maintenance window, customers may experience intermittent errors or degraded Messaging performance on all Messaging Channels for up to 20 minutes during the window, and agents may experience messaging delays or delayed ticket creation.

There is no data loss expected, and the service will resume seamlessly once the maintenance completes.

Outside of the specific windows outlined in the table above, customers should not experience any service impact.

What do customers have to do?

Customers are not required to take any action. Customers are recommended NOT to set ticket status to "CLOSED" for ongoing Messaging tickets that are open during the maintenance window so that any delayed messages can still be appended to the ticket after database maintenance is completed. If an ongoing messaging ticket is closed during the degraded performance window, messages not yet appended to the transcript could create another new ticket.

Why we're doing this: 

The Zendesk Messaging team is performing this maintenance work to improve the stability and scalability (storage capacity and general performance improvements) of datastores in the new Messaging Backend. This allows us to improve reliability and performance for existing and future customers to the new Messaging Backend.

articles.name: Can agents see their AutoQA scores in Zendesk QA?
articles.title: Can agents see their AutoQA scores in Zendesk QA?
articles.body:
Question

Can agents see their AutoQA scores in Zendesk QA? 

Answer

Agents can see the AutoQA scores for their own tickets if self-reviews are enabled in the workspace.

For more information, see this article: Setting up autoscoring in Zendesk QA using AutoQA.

articles.name: Do I need to have a Zendesk account to use Zendesk QA?
articles.title: Do I need to have a Zendesk account to use Zendesk QA?
articles.body:
Question

Is a Zendesk account required to use Zendesk QA or can I use it with a different help desk as well?

Answer

You need a Zendesk account to use Zendesk QA, but you can add other help desk connections once you've connected your Zendesk account.

For more information, see the articles: 

  • Setting up your Zendesk QA account and connecting your help desk
  • Integrating Zendesk QA

articles.name: Why is there a delay between my IVR initial greeting and the default option?
articles.title: Why is there a delay between my IVR initial greeting and the default option?
articles.body:
Question

When no IVR menu selection is made, what is causing the delay between the IVR initial greeting and the Default option of my Route?

Answer

This is an expected behavior. The IVR greeting plays 3 times when no selection is made. Then, the Keypress > Default option appears.

Zendesk allows 5 seconds for the caller to enter a key. The network provider adds an additional 5 seconds of timeout, before routing to the default group.

For more information, see these articles:

  • How do I set up an IVR?
  • Routing incoming calls with IVR

articles.name: What do the assignments conditions in Zendesk QA mean?
articles.title: What do the assignments conditions in Zendesk QA mean?
articles.body:
Question

I would like to understand how to set up the conditions in assignments. What do these filters mean?

Answer

The conditions of assignments in Zendesk QA are the same as the conversation filters. You can create your own set of filters in the conversation view and convert them into assignments.

For more information, see the article:

  • Finding conversations to review using custom filters
  • Setting up assignments

articles.name: Why am I seeing already reviewed tickets in my assignments in Zendesk QA?
articles.title: Why am I seeing already reviewed tickets in my assignments in Zendesk QA?
articles.body:
Question

I keep getting already reviewed tickets in my assignments, why is that happening?

Answer

The assignments in Zendesk QA do not by default offer only unreviewed tickets. You need to add a condition to your assignment Review status | is | not reviewed. 

For more information, see this article: Setting up assignments.

articles.name: Why does the call disconnect when the browser is refreshed?
articles.title: Why does the call disconnect when the browser is refreshed?
articles.body:
Question

Why did the ongoing call disconnect when I refreshed my browser? 

Answer

When you refresh the browser during a Zendesk Talk call, the call may disconnect because the refresh interrupts the session between you and the Zendesk server. Here are some reasons for this issue:

  • Session interruption: Refreshing the browser breaks the session with the Talk server. This interruption disconnects ongoing calls
  • Re-initialization: When you refresh, the browser has to reload resources and re-establish connections. The active call can't be maintained during this process and gets disconnected
  • Client-side handling: Talk relies on the client-side application to manage call connections. Refreshing the browser resets the client application, terminating active calls
  • WebRTC connection: Talk uses WebRTC (Web Real-Time Communication) for voice calls. Refreshing the browser disrupts the WebRTC connection, causing the call to drop

To avoid call disconnections due to browser refreshes

  • Avoid refreshing the browser while on a call.
  • Open Zendesk in a different window for actions that may require a refresh to avoid affecting the call.

For more information, see these articles:

  • How can I troubleshoot Talk issues? 
  • Talk network requirements
  • What are the most common Talk error messages?

articles.name: How can I prevent omnichannel routing from routing chat and messaging tickets?
articles.title: How can I prevent omnichannel routing from routing chat and messaging tickets?
articles.body:
Question

I am using omnichannel routing (OCR) however, I do not want to route chat and messaging tickets. How can I avoid routing those tickets?

Answer

If you do not want chat and messaging tickets to be routed at all, follow these steps:

  1. Set the capacity for the Messaging channel to 0, for all agents
  2. Create a unified agent status > Make the agents Offline for messaging tickets

If you want to route some chat or messaging tickets, use either of these workarounds:

  • On Enterprise and Professional plans, turn on skill-based routing > create a skill with no agent > Create a trigger and use the Conditions to affect the tickets of your choice, and route them to that skill in your Actions
  • Otherwise, create a group with no agents > create a trigger and assign the tickets of your choice to that empty group you created in the Actions

articles.name: Who can see calibrations in Zendesk QA?
articles.title: Who can see calibrations in Zendesk QA?
articles.body:
Question

Who can see calibrations in Zendesk QA? 

Answer

Agents do not see any conversation-related information in Calibration. No notifications are sent to reviewers, so it's up to the Workspace Manager or Lead to inform reviewers about the Calibration Session and its due date. 

For more information, see the articles:

  • Setting up calibration in Zendesk QA
  • Understanding roles and permissions in Zendesk QA

articles.name: How do I partially accept a dispute in Zendesk QA?
articles.title: How do I partially accept a dispute in Zendesk QA?
articles.body:
Question

I don't fully agree with the dispute in Zendesk QA, how can I partially accept it?

Answer

If you agree with only some of the disputed rating categories, you can select Accept dispute and change only the categories you agree with. Once done, the dispute shows as partially accepted.

For more information, see this article: Disputing a review.

articles.name: Can the users be anonymous in Zendesk QA?
articles.title: Can the users be anonymous in Zendesk QA?
articles.body:
Question

Can the reviewers and reviewees be anonymous in Zendesk QA? 

Answer

Reviewers and reviewees cannot be anonymous. However, users can change their names and hide their identity this way. For example, they can use code words with variations to differentiate users without using real names. 

As a Zendesk QA user, you can only change your own name.

articles.name: Service Incident - August 20, 2024 - Support | Multiple Pods - Email processing delays
articles.title: Service Incident - August 20, 2024 - Support | Multiple Pods - Email processing delays
articles.body:
SUMMARY

On August 20, 2024 from 00:13 to 10:16 UTC, Support customers on Pods 13, 18, 19, 23, and 25 experienced delays with emails not creating or updating tickets.

 

Timeline

August 20, 2024 02:12 AM UTC | August 19, 2024 07:12 PM PT

We are aware of an issue with emails not creating or updating tickets across multiple pods. Investigations are currently ongoing and we will provide another update in 30 minutes.

August 20, 2024 02:32 AM UTC | August 19, 2024 07:32 PM PT

We have indications in our logs that the issue causing ticket creation and updates may be related to a traffic spike. We are making progress in our investigations, but have not nailed down a root cause just yet. More information in the next 30 minutes.

August 20, 2024 02:59 AM UTC | August 19, 2024 07:59 PM PT

Traffic spikes in our email system may result in customers experiencing delays in ticket creation or receiving ticket updates. We are looking at ways to reduce the traffic so that the email queue can be processed. Next update expected in 30 minutes.

August 20, 2024 03:31 AM UTC | August 19, 2024 08:31 PM PT

We continue to investigate the issue with our email service that is resulting in delayed ticket updates and ticket creation. Our team is working to mitigate the issue. This issue may affect accounts on pods 13, 18, 19, 23, 25 and 28. Next update in 30 minutes.

August 20, 2024 04:03 AM UTC | August 19, 2024 09:03 PM PT

We are currently testing a potential fix for the Support ticket delays. Once that is confirmed to work as intended, we expect to see a reduction in our queued email backlog, resulting in tickets being created and updated. We will provide another update in 30 minutes. Thanks for your patience while we work through this issue.

August 20, 2024 04:41 AM UTC | August 19, 2024 09:41 PM PT

Our teams are working at the highest priority to fix the issue with email processing affecting Support ticketing. We expect all emails sent during this incident to start reprocessing once the issue is resolved. We will provide the next update as soon as we have progress to share.

August 20, 2024 05:33 AM UTC | August 19, 2024 10:33 PM PT

We continue to work on a fix for the email processing issues on multiple pods. We are rolling out our first potential fix now after successfully testing it. Apologies for the extended impact today; we will provide the next update when we have one. Thank you.

August 20, 2024 07:29 AM UTC | August 20, 2024 12:29 AM PT

Our team has rolled out a fix to all affected pods in an attempt to resolve the Support email ticket issues. We are monitoring our email backlog for improvements.

August 20, 2024 08:41 AM UTC | August 20, 2024 01:41 AM PT

We can see an improvement to our backlog and are continuing to monitor. Once the backlog has cleared, tickets will start creating at a normal pace again. Unfortunately there is no ETA or workaround at this time. If you need to access the emails in the meantime, we recommend checking the email inbox of the linked email address. We will provide another update when we have one.

August 20, 2024 10:27 AM UTC | August 20, 2024 03:27 AM PT

Our team has cleared the backlog, and ticket creation has returned to normal operations. With this, the service incident has been resolved. The backlog has been completed and tickets created or updated in chronological order. All emails impacted by the incident have been reprocessed and none were lost. Please note that you will not need to reconfigure the forwarding integration. We apologise for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience.

 

POST-MORTEM

Root Cause Analysis

This incident was caused by an unexpected bug in email routing logic which created an internal routing loop, causing a backup on email processing queues which led to delays.

Resolution

To fix this issue, we released an update to address the bug in routing logic and allocated additional resources to allow the backlog of emails to process.

Remediation Items

  1. Improve email routing logic to avoid similar scenarios in the future.
  2. Revisit alerting to improve response times for growing email processing queues.
  3. Update documentation and runbooks.

 

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Release notes through 2024-08-16
articles.title: Release notes through 2024-08-16
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released in the last month.

This week's release notes include:

    • App Marketplace
    • Products with no updates this week
  •  

App Marketplace

New
  • AI Sentiment Analysis (Support)
    AI Sentiment Analysis is designed to provide you with real-time insights into customer emotions. Sentiment Analysis for Zendesk helps you prioritize and route tickets effectively, ensuring each customer gets the attention they deserve. Quickly identify and address negative sentiment, turning issues into opportunities to delight customers.  Prioritize and route tickets based on sentiment and issue, ensuring critical tickets are handled first.  Monitor sentiment trends to identify and address problems early, preventing negative experiences.
  • Redact Attachments (Support)
    Redact Attachments is designed to help you automatically remove or redact attachments in Zendesk tickets, saving storage costs and protecting sensitive information. With a simple setup, you can ensure all attachments are securely redacted, leaving only the essential ticket information.
  • My AskAI for Support (Support)
    My AskAI for Support is the easy-to-setup AI customer support agent for your Zendesk workspace that you've been looking for. Available 24/7 to answer your customers’ questions, trained on all your help docs, it knows everything about your business. Save time and money, and allow your CS team to spend more time on Customer Success, complex queries, and higher-value customers and less time on generic, first-line support questions.
  • Vexo 128 (Theme)
    Vexo 128 is an exceptional Zendesk theme with a sleek, professional design and numerous features. It offers various customizable blocks and call-to-action elements and is easily branded and tailored without coding. This enables the rapid creation of a help center that will impress your customers.
  • Gleen Agent Assist (Support)
    Gleen Agent Assist helps you revolutionize your customer service.  Gleen Agent Assist is the hallucination-free AI sidekick that transforms agents into customer champions. This powerhouse tool supercharges your support team, dramatically boosting response speed and quality.  Cut average response time by 56%, leaving customers amazed at your lightning-fast service.  Sound like a native in 90+ languages, breaking down communication barriers effortlessly.  Deliver consistently accurate, high-quality responses that hit the mark every time.
  • Linked Tickets By Saasly (Support) (paid)
    Linked Tickets By Saasly lets you efficiently manage and track tickets collectively, ensuring quick and consistent updates via broadcast messages to keep agents informed.  Centralize tracking as all issues are tracked from the primary ticket.  Efficiently communicate with status updates sent via broadcast messages to all agents.  Easily unlink tickets if necessary and more.
  • CSAT-Timer (Support (paid)
    CSAT-Timer uses user-defined customizable rules to set timers based on your messaging channels. When a specific channel offers satisfaction, a new timer will be created in the ticket sidebar, displaying the time progress. If the timer expires before the user responds, the ticket will be automatically closed, tagged with Closed-by-CSAT-APP, and a notification will be sent to the top bar app informing the assignee of the closure.
  • VOC.AI Chatbot (Support)
    VOC.AI Chatbot is a cutting-edge solution designed to revolutionize customer service and streamline your support processes. Train the AI Chatbot with your own materials to handle customer support questions and assist in product recommendations, driving customer purchases and boosting sales.
  • Group Field Sync (Support) (paid)
    Group Field Sync lets you map and sync any field to the native Group field in Zendesk. This happens in real time, and does not require submitting the ticket. It can even be used to create hide/show logic on forms that react in real time to group changes in the Assignee field.
  • Organization Cards (Support) (paid)
    Organization Cards keep your support agents informed with essential organization details at their fingertips. This app seamlessly integrates into the Zendesk ticket sidebar, displaying critical organization information directly within the ticket view. It's perfect for teams managing complex customer relationships where every detail matters.

 

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Explore

  • Mobile SDKs v2.23.0

  • Talk

  • Guide and machine learning
  • Chat and messaging
  • AI agents (formerly bots)
  • Admin Center
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: Deprecating the Zopim Chat REST API domain
articles.title: Deprecating the Zopim Chat REST API domain
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout starts Rollout ends
August 19, 2024 October 29, 2024 October 29, 2024

 

Starting October 29, 2024, Zendesk will update the domain for its Zopim Chat REST API.

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

Zendesk is updating the domain for its Zopim Chat REST API. Beginning October 29, 2024, the current Zopim Chat REST API path of www.zopim.com/api/v2 will be replaced with {subdomain}.zendesk.com/api/v2/chat. Both paths will be available simultaneously until this date, giving you time to transition.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

Zendesk is updating the Zopim Chat REST API to align it with the structure of our other APIs. This change is a necessary step toward migrating Chat to Zendesk's native infrastructure, which will enhance reliability and ensure more consistent performance in the future.

What do I need to do?

Zendesk is updating the Zopim Chat REST API to align it with the structure of our other APIs. This change is a necessary step toward migrating Chat to Zendesk's native infrastructure, which will enhance reliability and ensure more consistent performance in the future.

Although the transition is straightforward, it may be time-consuming depending on how many instances in your codebase rely on the current URL. Therefore, we advise starting these updates as soon as possible to ensure a seamless transition.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Announcing Public API for Media
articles.title: Announcing Public API for Media
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout starts Rollout ends
August 19, 2024 August 20, 2024 August 20, 2024

Zendesk is excited to announce the Public API for Media, a solution designed to streamline the interaction and management of images and article attachments through external integrations based on REST API.

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

We are launching the Public API for Media, which provides comprehensive CRUD (create, read, update, delete) capabilities as well as advanced features like media renaming and replacement, categorization, and permission controls. This new API marks the beginning of a phased transition towards replacing the current HC API with a more refined and sophisticated API landscape.

With the Public API for Media, developers can programmatically manage media resources through a centralized Guide Media Library, a repository designed to handle all media files at the account level.

Core functionalities include:

  • Create Media: Upload new images and article attachments to the media library with relevant metadata.
  • Read Media: Retrieve and view media files and their details.
  • Update Media:
    • Renaming Media: Update the names of images and article attachments.
    • Replacing Media: Replace existing media in all their placements.
  • Delete Media: Remove outdated or unnecessary media to keep the repository clean.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

The Public API for media management is essential for maintaining consistency and branding across various projects. It simplifies media management by offering a centralized repository for monitoring and overseeing all media files. This update will boost efficiency in updating and maintaining media content and foster improved collaboration by providing shared access to media resources. Ultimately, this transition to the new API will empower developers with superior external integration capabilities, paving the way for a more refined and sophisticated API landscape, gradually phasing out the current HC API.

What do I need to do?

Customers using the current HC API for media management will need to transition to the new Public API for Media to take advantage of its enhanced functionalities and capabilities. Developers should review Guide Medias in the developer documentation to understand how to interact with the new API and make necessary adjustments to their integrations.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Generative replies are not generating answers
articles.title: Generative replies are not generating answers
articles.body:
Issue symptoms

My AI agent with generative replies configured is not able to generate answers from help center articles. Instead, my AI agent sends an error message that says: Sorry I couldn't find a good answer to your question.

Resolution steps

For the AI agent to generate answers, both of the following must be true:

  • Your help center must have the setting Require sign in disabled
  • The articles you want your AI agent to generate answers from must have viewing permissions set to Visible to everyone

For more information, see this article: Using AI to generate replies in a conversation bot.

articles.name: Service Incident - August 15th, 2024
articles.title: Service Incident - August 15th, 2024
articles.body:
SUMMARY

August 15, 2024 01:46 PM UTC | August 15, 2024 06:46 AM PT
Thank you for your patience while we worked through this incident. Chat triggers are now working as expected, and we no longer see errors related to this issue. We are marking this as fully resolved.

August 15, 2024 01:29 PM UTC | August 15, 2024 06:29 AM PT
The rollback for the issue related to Chat triggers firing incorrectly has finished updating across all pods. We appreciate your patience as we monitor the situation until full resolution.

August 15, 2024 01:18 PM UTC | August 15, 2024 06:18 AM PT
We are rolling back a recent deploy related to Chat triggers. Please note that a possible side effect of this incident is that incorrect Chat tags can be added to chats, and this can cause misrouting. Next update in 30 min.

August 15, 2024 01:06 PM UTC | August 15, 2024 06:06 AM PT
We’re currently investigating reports of Chat triggers incorrectly firing, across all Pods. More details soon.

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Can I delete a rejected dispute in Zendesk QA?
articles.title: Can I delete a rejected dispute in Zendesk QA?
articles.body:
Question

Can I delete a dispute that has been rejected?

Answer

Once the dispute has been rejected you cannot make any changes to it. However, you can delete the review and this will remove the existing dispute as well.

For more information, see this article: Disputing a review.

articles.name: Why are my tickets automatically routed to a specific agent?
articles.title: Why are my tickets automatically routed to a specific agent?
articles.body:
Question

Why are tickets automatically routed to my agent? Omnichannel routing is turned off and no app is assigning tickets.

Answer

Without omnichannel routing or an app, Zendesk can automatically assign tickets to an agent due to a system ticket rule. The rule assigns tickets to an agent when:

  • Only one agent is in the assigned group
  • All other agents in the assigned group are either light agents or contributors

To avoid this, add another agent to your group or don't assign that group to your tickets.

Note: When the system assigns a New ticket to an agent, the ticket status changes to Open.

articles.name: How do I exclude bots from review assignments in Zendesk QA?
articles.title: How do I exclude bots from review assignments in Zendesk QA?
articles.body:
Question

I want to exclude bots from review assignments in Zendesk QA. How do I set it up?

Answer

It is only possible to exclude existing users within the workspace. Excluding bot/s (not a user) cannot be added as a condition in your assignment settings by default.

As a workaround, you can create a filter 'Participant is not bot name' to exclude the bot as participant.

To add this filter

  1. Click the Conversion icon in the left sidebar.
  2. Select or create a filter (either public or private)
  3. Add the filter conditions.
  • Participant | is | <name of your bot>
  • Bot | is | <name of your bot>
  • Click Create Filter to save

Then you can exclude/include the bots under reviewer and reviewees by going to assignment settings where you would want to apply the filter. 

To edit your assignment settings

  1. Go to the Dashboard.
  2. Choose the assignment you want to edit.
  3. Click the dropdown and choose the created filter in reviewer or reviewees. 

For more information, see these article:

  • Finding conversations to review using custom filters.

articles.name: Can I retake a quiz in Zendesk QA?
articles.title: Can I retake a quiz in Zendesk QA?
articles.body:
Question

If I have already taken a quiz, can I retake it?

Answer

Once you submit the answers, you cannot retake the quiz or change the answers.

For more information, see this article: Creating and managing quizzes.

articles.name: Release notes through 2024-08-09
articles.title: Release notes through 2024-08-09
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released in the last month.

This week's release notes include:

    • Explore
    • App Marketplace
    • Mobile SDKs
    • Products with no updates this week

Explore

New

  • The Achieved SLA metrics were updated in the SLAs and Group SLAs datasets to ensure that they provide more accurate results. Here is the full list of the updated metrics:
    • Achieved SLA tickets
    • Achieved SLA policies
    • Achieved group SLA tickets
    • Achieved group SLA policies.

      If you use one of these metrics in your custom dashboards, republish them. For the full list of the SLA metrics and their formulas, see Metrics and attributes for Zendesk Support.

Mobile SDKs v2.23.0

iOS

Added

  • Ability to switch between different instances of the Zendesk SDK within the same mobile app. (This is a significant capability for customers with multiple brands or multiple territories within a single app.)
  • Support for different Conversation Extension sizes.

Android

Added

  • Ability to switch between different instances of the Zendesk SDK within the same mobile app. (This is a significant capability for customers with multiple brands or multiple territories within a single app.)
  • Added Android 15 Support. The SDK is now completely compatible with Android 15, aligning with the recent updates and functionality provided by Google.
  • Support for different Conversation Extension sizes.

App Marketplace

New
  • RunLLM (Support)
    • RunLLM provides high-quality answers to save you time and accelerate customer application. With RunLLM's Zendesk app, you can auto-generate responses to customer tickets with the click of a button, and you can refine responses using the app's chat mode. Use the ticket's history and latest message to guide its answers and allow your team to chat with the assistant to refine responses.  
  • Xavi (Theme)
    • Xavi has a clean and modern layout and comes with all the necessary features to help you bring your help center vision to life.  This theme gets you off to a fantastic start with six (or more) image boxes that can be linked to external pages and customizable header and footer links.
  • Calisto (Theme)
    • Calisto is a creative Zendesk theme designed for technology, photographers, designers, developers, creatives, artists, etc. The theme is built with the most advanced builder (Settings option). The theme helps you to introduce yourself to visitors in a professional way, to showcase your work, and to display your services and different types of content.
  • Innocalls Soft Phone (Support)
    • Innocalls Soft Phone seamlessly integrates with Zendesk, providing a comprehensive telephony solution tailored to enhance your customer support experience. Make and receive calls directly within Zendesk, eliminating the need for switching between multiple platforms and enhancing productivity.  With call history tracking, easily review past interactions and access caller information for personalized customer support. Empower your support team to handle customer queries more efficiently with real-time caller information display, enabling them to provide timely and informed assistance.
  • Descope (Support)
    • Descope helps organizations add seamless, secure SSO for their end users across their applications, including cloud applications like Zendesk.  Descope is a drag-and-drop customer authentication and identity management platform. Their no/low code CIAM solution helps hundreds of organizations easily create and customize their entire user journey using visual workflows – from authentication and authorization to MFA and federated SSO.
  • ChatGPT Assistant Plus by Adjacent (Support)
    • ChatGPT Assistant Plus by Adjacent captures conversation essence, analyzes tone, and suggests responses with touch. New features include responses provided by the app now include information extracted directly from Zendesk's knowledge base, enhancing the relevance and accuracy of the answers. Responses are now more readable thanks to better formatting, which includes line breaks, bullet points, and other elements for a clear presentation.
  • Hourly Billing (Support) (paid)
    • Hourly Billing is designed to track and invoice the time your agents spend working on support tickets. Whether in Zendesk Support or Zendesk Talk, Hourly Billing ensures you capture every billable moment efficiently and accurately.  Monitor the time your agents dedicate to each support ticket within Zendesk Support, ensuring precise billing and productivity analysis. Generate comprehensive reports that detail the time tracked, making invoicing clients straightforward and transparent.
  • Mobile App Generator (Support)
    • Mobile App Generator creates a mobile app for your end users that you can personalize with your branding and logo. Zero coding is needed. Your end users can install the app on their phones and use it to manage their tickets, receive push notifications when their tickets are updated, and more.
  • Omneo (Support)
    • Omneo is an omnichannel clienteling, loyalty, and CX platform that allows retailers to create and use customer data in stores and online that primarily helps customers shop more and more often. The Omneo Zendesk integrations enable Omneo clients to quickly access and edit customer profiles and loyalty data directly within the Zendesk agent interface, ensuring any changes are instantly synchronized back to the brand's entire CX ecosystem.
  • ClientZen (Support)
    • ClientZen automates feedback analysis and gives you accurate insights and instant answers with Mantra AI and real-time monitoring. Features include items like smart tagging applied automatically to every feedback (tickets, reviews, calls & more), accurate insights (contact reasons, recurring issues, main questions, and top feature requests), real-time monitoring, and quick answers on specific customer experience topics with Mantra AI
  • Organization Views (Support) (paid)
    • Organization Views empowers Zendesk customers to efficiently manage and visualize their organizations. With this app, you can effortlessly create customized views of your organizations by filtering through various organization details and custom fields.
  • Laxo 128 (Theme)
    • Laxo 128 is a standout Zendesk theme, presenting a sleek and professional design packed with numerous features. It offers a range of customizable blocks and call-to-action elements, all easily brandable and adjustable without the need for coding.
  • Sentiment Workflow Assistant (Support)
    • Sentiment Workflow Assistant integrates seamlessly with your existing support system to provide real-time analysis and actionable insights. Designed to enhance the capabilities of the support agents, this app allows for the creation and utilization of sophisticated workflows tailored to various use cases.  Easily design workflows to handle specific tasks such as checking customer orders, verifying item return policies, and fetching relevant data.
  • Cobrowse for Support by Blitzz (Support) (Chat)
    • Cobrowse for Support/Chat by Blitzz helps you provide remote support to your customers using features like co-browse, screen sharing, and live video integrated directly within apps you already use. Blitzz Cobrowse for Zendesk integrates right inside your Zendesk interface and allows you to instantly see what your customers see on your website or Mobile App in real time and guide them if they need help filling out a form or completing an order.
  • viaSocket (Sell)
    • viaSocket automates repetitive task processes across various business functions such as HR, Sales, Marketing, and Support tasks. It allows users to create workflows using drag-and-drop functionality, utilize AI for workflow creation and modification, and efficiently manage data using tables. Retrieve data from different apps using viaSocket and integrate it with over 6000 applications.
  • LiveX AI Search (Support)
    • LiveX AI Search transforms your Zendesk support with LiveX AI’s unique solution. Combining Gen-AI powered search with GPT-like AI chat, this integration offers a seamless user experience, enhancing accuracy and interaction quality through intelligent conversational capabilities. Advanced AI analyzes user queries in real time, providing highly relevant search results and personalized responses that adapt to the context of each interaction.  The system continuously learns from user interactions to refine search accuracy and improve response quality, ensuring that the support provided evolves with user needs and preferences.

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Talk
  • Guide and machine learning
  • Chat and messaging
  • AI agents (formerly bots)
  • Admin Center
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: Service Incident - August 9, 2024 - Support | Pod 17 - Issues with ticket opening/viewing
articles.title: Service Incident - August 9, 2024 - Support | Pod 17 - Issues with ticket opening/viewing
articles.body:
SUMMARY

On August 9, 2024 from 15:46 UTC to 15:57 UTC, Support customers on Pod 17 experienced various issues such as error codes, slow loading times, and inability to open tickets or view messages within the product UI. 

Timeline

August 09, 2024 04:13 PM UTC | August 09, 2024 09:13 AM PT
We're investigating reports of users being unable to view Support tickets on Pod 17 and are already seeing recovery. We will provide additional updates in 30 mins or sooner as we confirm full stability.

August 09, 2024 04:32 PM UTC | August 09, 2024 09:32 AM PT
From 15:46 UTC to 15:57 UTC, Support customers on Pod 17 experienced issues loading tickets. Performance has stabilized and we will continue to monitor performance. Next update in an hour or when we have new information.

August 09, 2024 04:51 PM UTC | August 09, 2024 09:51 AM PT
The Support performance issues that occurred on Pod 17 from 15:46 UTC to 15:57 UTC are now fully resolved. We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your patience.

 

POST-MORTEM

Root Cause Analysis

This incident was caused by the unexpected reboot of a system that speeds up data retrieval by caching information in memory. Due to an inadequate response to this failure, the Agent-graph component continued to wait up to 60 seconds for a response, causing timeout errors and resulting in 503 service errors. Contributing factors include that the system did not switch to an alternative data source in a timely manner, and the monitors in place did not trigger alerts because the issue was resolved before hitting the thresholds.

Resolution

To fix this issue, the system automatically recovered as the memory-caching system came back online. We identified that the reboot of this system caused the delays, and it was confirmed that the issue was self-resolving, requiring no immediate manual intervention to restore service.

Remediation Items

  1. Reduced timeout for user cache retrieval.
  2. Consider performing chaos testing to simulate such failures in a controlled environment. 
  3. Review and adjust alert thresholds to ensure quicker detection and response time.
  4. Reach out to AWS to investigate the unexpected reboot of the memory-caching system to prevent similar future occurrences.

 

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Using webhooks to integrate with Amazon EventBridge
articles.title: Using webhooks to integrate with Amazon EventBridge
articles.body:
What's my plan?

Quick Look: Admin Center > Apps and integrations > Webhooks > Webhooks

Zendesk webhooks are a powerful tool to keep your other systems updated with changes in your Zendesk account. Using webhooks to integrate with Amazon EventBridge creates the opportunity for more sophisticated workflows with real-time data processing. This article describes how to use webhooks to send Zendesk events to Amazon EventBridge.

This article contains the following topics:
  • Requirements for sending events to Amazon EventBridge with webhooks
  • Creating your EventBridge event bus
  • Creating a Lambda function to receive the webhook payload
  • Creating a Zendesk webhook to connect to Amazon EventBridge

Requirements for sending events to Amazon EventBridge with webhooks

The following requirements must be met to use webhooks to connect with Amazon EventBridge:
  • You must be an admin in your Zendesk account.
  • You must have an AWS account with EventBridge set up.

    Additionally, you should have a basic understanding of AWS services, including EventBridge.

Creating your EventBridge event bus

Before creating the webhook, you must create an EventBridge event bus.

Note the ARN, which is required in a later step. The ARN should be formatted in the following way: 
arn:aws:events:{REGION}:{AWS_ID}:event-bus/{EVENT_BUS_ID}

Creating a Lambda function to receive the webhook payload

A Lambda function is required to receive the webhook, confirm the webhook's signature, and pass the webhook payload on to the EventBridge event bus you created.

To create a Lambda function
  1. Use the AWS Lambda console to create a new Lambda function. Complete the fields as need. Under the Advanced settings, select Enable function URL and then select NONE for the authentication method.

    Note the Function URL. This is the public URL you'll connect your webhook to.

  2. Add the following code to the Code source window, then click Deploy. 
    import json
import hashlib
import hmac
import os
import base64
import logging

import boto3

LOGGER = logging.getLogger()
LOGGER.setLevel('INFO')

EVENTBRIDGE = boto3.client('events')

# Set these values in your Lambda function environment variables.
EVENT_BUS_ARN = os.environ['EVENT_BUS_ARN']
WEBHOOK_SECRET = os.environ['WEBHOOK_SECRET'].encode('utf-8')


def verify_signature(payload, signature, timestamp):
    '''Verify the provided webhook signature was created by Zendesk's Webhook feature.'''
    combined = timestamp + payload
    combined_bytes = combined.encode('utf-8')
    computed_hmac = hmac.new(WEBHOOK_SECRET, combined_bytes, hashlib.sha256)
    computed_signature = base64.b64encode(computed_hmac.digest()).decode('utf-8')
    return hmac.compare_digest(computed_signature, signature)


def webhook_to_eventbridge(event):
    '''Forward the webhook body to AWS EventBridge.'''
    payload = event['body']
    signature = event['headers'].get('x-zendesk-webhook-signature', '')
    timestamp = event['headers'].get('x-zendesk-webhook-signature-timestamp', '')

    if not verify_signature(payload, signature, timestamp):
        LOGGER.warning('Received webhook with invalid signature')
        return {
            'statusCode': 403,
            'body': json.dumps({'message': 'Forbidden'}),
        }

    payload_dict = json.loads(payload) if isinstance(payload, str) else payload
    event_source = payload_dict.get('source', 'webhook.custom')
    detail_type = payload_dict.get('type', 'defaultDetailType')

    put_events_response = EVENTBRIDGE.put_events(
        Entries=[
            {
                'Source': event_source,
                'DetailType': detail_type,
                'Detail': json.dumps(payload_dict),
                'EventBusName': EVENT_BUS_ARN,
            }
        ]
    )

    response_entries = put_events_response.get('Entries', [])
    if len(response_entries) == 0 or 'ErrorCode' in response_entries[0]:
        LOGGER.error(f'Push to event bridge failed: {response_entries}')
        return {
            'statusCode': 500,
            'body': json.dumps(
                {
                    'message': 'Failed to send event to EventBridge',
                    'response': put_events_response,
                }
            ),
        }

    return {
        'statusCode': 200,
        'body': json.dumps(
            {
                'message': 'Event successfully sent to EventBridge',
                'response': put_events_response,
            }
        ),
    }


def lambda_handler(event, context):
    try:
        return webhook_to_eventbridge(event)
    except Exception as e:
        LOGGER.exception('Error handling webhook')
        return {
            'statusCode': 500,
            'body': json.dumps({'message': 'Error handling webhook', 'error': str(e)}),
        }
  3. Add two environmental variables to the Lambda function:
    • EVENT_BUS_ARN: Set this to the ARN value you got when creating the EventBridge event bus. This is the event bus location.
    • WEBHOOK_SECRET: After you create the webhook, you'll need to set this to the webhook secret.
  4. Use the AWS IAM console to create a role for the AWS Lambda service.

    Note the role's name. You'll need this information to assign the role to your Lambda function.

  5. After creating the role, edit it to add the EventBridge event bus ARN.
    1. Open the role.
    2. Under Step 2: Add permissions click Edit and select Create inline policy.
    3. Search for EventBridge services and select the PutEvents method.
    4. Under Resources, click Add ARNs.
    5. Enter the EventBridge event bus ARN and click Next.
    6. Enter a Name for your policy and click Create policy.
  6. Use the AWS Lambda console to open the Lambda function you created and assign the IAM role to it. On the Configuration tab, select Permissions and click Edit. At the bottom of the page, select the role's name and click Save.

Creating a Zendesk webhook to connect to Amazon EventBridge

After creating the EventBridge event bus and configuring the Lambda function, you need to create the webhook itself.

To create a webhook to integrate with Amazon EventBright
  1. In Admin Center, click Apps and integrations in the sidebar, then select Webhooks > Webhooks.
  2. Create the webhook, making sure to specify the following values:
    • Set the Endpoint URL to the Function URL you got when you created the Lambda function.
    • Set Authentication to None.
    Note: Zendesk generates a secret key during the creation process for each webhook. To successfully connect your webhook to Amazon EventBridge, you must copy and paste this secret key into your Lambda function's WEBHOOK_SECRET environmental variable. See Creating a Lambda function to receive the webhook payload.
  3. Click Create webhook.
Disclaimer: This article, including the integration code, is provided for general informational purposes only. Zendesk does not support or guarantee the code. Zendesk also can't provide support for third-party technologies, such as Amazon EventBridge. Post any issues you have in the comments section or try searching for a solution online.

articles.name: Service Incident - August 8, 2024 - Explore | Pods 17, 18, 28, 29 - Errors when creating new reports
articles.title: Service Incident - August 8, 2024 - Explore | Pods 17, 18, 28, 29 - Errors when creating new reports
articles.body:
SUMMARY

On August 7, 2024 from 17:00 UTC to August 8, 2024, 16:45 UTC, some customers on Pods 17, 18, 28, 29 experienced errors while trying to create new reports using the Explore feature. This impacted their ability to generate insights and access critical data reports.

 

Timeline

August 08, 2024 03:35 PM UTC | August 08, 2024 08:35 AM PT
We are investigating reports of Explore customers with a large number of datasets being unable to create new reports and datasets. As a workaround, you can create a new report by cloning an existing report and editing that report, however you will still be unable to create new datasets. Next update in 30 minutes or when we have new information.

August 08, 2024 04:00 PM UTC | August 08, 2024 09:00 AM PT
Our engineers continue to investigating an issue impacting the ability to create new Explore reports and datasets. We have narrowed the scope of impact to pods 17, 18, 28, 29, and 31. Next update in one hour or when we have new information to share.

August 08, 2024 04:54 PM UTC | August 08, 2024 09:54 AM PT
Our engineers remain focused on resolving the issue affecting the creation of new Explore reports and datasets. We will provide the next update in 2 hours or when we have new information to share.

August 08, 2024 05:21 PM UTC | August 08, 2024 10:21 AM PT
Our engineers have rolled out a fix and we have confirmed that you can now create new reports and datasets. The issue is now fully resolved. Please let us know if you continue to experience issues.

 

POST-MORTEM

Root Cause Analysis

This incident was caused by a performance degradation following an upgrade to our database infrastructure provided by our partner. The upgrade removed query caching that our system previously relied upon, significantly slowing down certain queries crucial to the Explore feature.

Resolution

To fix this issue, we analyzed the problematic queries and implemented effective indexing strategies. This immediate action restored the query performance to its expected levels, thereby resolving the errors customers were experiencing.

Remediation Items

  1. Improve the monitoring system with specific alerts centered around SQL query latencies to catch performance issues early.
  2. Communicated the deprecation of query cache to other teams, ensuring they are aware of potential impacts and can take preemptive measures.
  3. Investigate optimizing queries by replacing "not in" statements with boolean values to align with the new database versions.
  4. Investigate implementing caching solutions using elastic cache or ProxySQL for repeated query results to avoid similar issues in the future.
  5. Ensure all changes, improvements, and processes are thoroughly documented in Confluence to share knowledge and prepare for similar future events.

 

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about your Zendesk, check out our system status page. The summary of our post-mortem investigation is usually posted here a few days after the incident has ended. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: How can I translate text from the source code of my help center?
articles.title: How can I translate text from the source code of my help center?
articles.body:
Question

What steps can I follow to translate text from the source code of my help center?

Answer

You can use dynamic content to translate text from your help center. The steps to follow are below:

  1. Enable your locale

    Note: The language variant must match your help center variant. Otherwise, the text won't be dynamically translated. For example, if your help center is in English (US), then you must enable the English (United States) locale. English (United Kingdom) won't match.
  2. Create your dynamic content > Generate the language variants for each language you will display
  3. Copy the placeholder from your dynamic content, which starts with {{dc.

  4. Open the code of your help center
  5. Replace the text you want to translate with the dynamic content placeholder from the step above
  6. Reformat the placeholder, for example, instead of: {{dc.example_dynamic_content}}, use this format: {{dc 'example_dynamic_content'}}
  7. Publish your changes

articles.name: Announcing change talk states based on general tasks
articles.title: Announcing change talk states based on general tasks
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout on
August 20, 2024 August 20, 2024

Zendesk Workforce management (WFM) is enhancing the General tasks configuration page by allowing admins to automatically sync general tasks with specific talk statuses.

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk WFM making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

Admins can now automatically sync general tasks with specific talk statuses. When agents clock in to a general task from the WFM app in the top navigation bar in Zendesk Support it now also automatically sets their Talk availability status, as defined by the admin for that general task. See Setting up WFM general tasks.

Why is Zendesk WFM making this change?

Legacy Tymeshift V1 and the WFM add-on have significant differences. See Migrating to the Zendesk Workforce management (WFM) add-on. The WFM add-on provides an improved experience for admins and agents through its faster, more stable platform. There are new capabilities available and additional improvements made regularly. In order to bring the two versions to parity, Zendesk WFM is enhancing the General tasks configuration page for customers on the WFM add-on. 

What do I need to do?

No action is required. To learn more see Setting up WFM general tasks.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.
